page.title: 09Local History
page.content: When writing on "Local History" in this area, the central topic must undoubtedly be Coal Mining. Probably the oldest colliery in this area was the Aberaman Colliery; sinking commenced in 1845 and the first coal was raised in 1850. The colliery (Ref 017.004) was extremely successful and was once described as being "the mainstay of the Powell Duffryn Steam Coal Company". The colliery was closed in 1965. The Pit Head Baths is now a D.I.Y. store and it stands on its own, as all other remaining buildings were demolished in February of this year (1985). Incidentally Abercwmboi translated into English means "Mouth of the haunted valley. The mine in Abercwmboi was opened in 1875 but was only ever used for pumping purposes.
